titles.title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior to convey an administrative site in San Juan County, New Mexico, to San Juan College.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior, USDA.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-256.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 151.

action.text: Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health Discharged.
Mr. Saxton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 695.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 248.

action.text: Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 8/2/1999--Passed House amended. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to convey to San Juan College in Farmington, New Mexico, for educational and recreational purposes real property not to exceed 20 acres known as the Old Jicarilla Site in San Juan County, New Mexico, not later than one year after the completion of a survey for determining the exact acreage and legal description of such lands. Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to identify any reservations of rights-of-way for ingress, egress, and utilities deemed appropriate. Revokes Public Land Order 3443 as it pertains to such lands.
